briefTitle: A Trial to Describe the Immunogenicity and Safety of 2 Doses of Bivalent rLP2086 (Trumenba) and a Pentavalent Meningococcal Vaccine in Healthy Subjects >=10 to <26 Years of Age.
officialTitle: A PHASE 3, RANDOMIZED, ACTIVE-CONTROLLED, OBSERVER-BLINDED STUDY TO ASSESS THE IMMUNOGENICITY, SAFETY, AND TOLERABILITY OF BIVALENT RLP2086 WHEN ADMINISTERED AS A 2-DOSE REGIMEN AND A FIRST-IN-HUMAN STUDY TO DESCRIBE THE IMMUNOGENICITY, SAFETY, AND TOLERABILITY OF A BIVALENT RLP2086-CONTAINING PENTAVALENT VACCINE (MENABCWY) IN HEALTHY SUBJECTS>=10 TO <26 YEARS OF AGE
summary: This study is examining safety and immunogenicity of 2 doses of Trumenba administered on a 0-,6- month schedule. This trial is also studying safety and immunogenicity of a meningococcal pentavalent vaccine.

primaryOutcome.measure: Stage1: Percentage of Participants Achieving Serum Bactericidal Assay Using Human Complement (hSBA) Titer Level >= Lower Limit of Quantitation (LLOQ) for All 4 Primary Test Strains Combined 1 Month After Vaccination 2 (Group 2 and 4 Combined)

commonTop: Injection site pain (PAIN AT INJECTION SITE)
